DataElement.preferredName: Transplant Conditioning Based Ideal Body Weight Dose Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indication of whether or not the conditioning regimen dose was based on an ideal body weight.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Transplant Conditioning Based Ideal Body Weight Dose
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant.  Conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection)._The fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provide the foundation for something._A person's optimum weight as calculated by a standard methodology._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy,
to a transplant.

Concepts.definition: Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant.  Conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection).

Property.preferredDefinition: The fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provide the foundation for something.:A person's optimum weight as calculated by a standard methodology.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

Concepts.definition: The fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provide the foundation for something.
A person's optimum weight as calculated by a standard methodology.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
